it.unica.foresee.commandlists.interfaces
Interface CommandList

All Superinterfaces:
java.util.Map<java.lang.String,Semantic>
All Known Implementing Classes:
ARTCommandList, FSCommandList
public interface CommandList
extends java.util.Map<java.lang.String,Semantic>

Interface to implement a list of commands to be used by an Interpreter .

To make a new command list that checks for a different set of commands implement this interface and override the loadCommandsSemantic() method, which is the one responsible for the binding between commands and semantics and for adding them to the Interpreter.command variable.

Each command is represented as a pair (String , Semantic ). The String is the command name, which will be looked for by the interpreter. The Semantic is an interface containing the method Semantic.exec(java.lang.String[], it.unica.foresee.core.Env) , which is the one that will contain the command instructions.

The exec function can use the variables declared in the Interpreter.env variable, which is an instance of Env .

Follows an example code which uses the above mentioned technique.

`
  command.put("mycommand", new Semantic(){
      public void exec(String args)
      {
          warn("You're now running the " + env.current_command + "command!";
      }
  });
 `

This example is very simple but shows everything needed to add a new command.

Method Detail

loadCommandsSemantic

CommandList loadCommandsSemantic()

Creates a binding between each command name and its meaning.

If you want to extend the recognized command list, override this function.
